bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to George L. Rives, July 2, 1888
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Mr B. Y. Payne to the Assistant Secretary of State
Return for the Quarter ended June 30th 1888.

SIr, I have the honor respectfully to transmit the following Returns for the quarter ended June 30th 1888, which consist of Digest of Invoice Book, Arrival and departures of American vessels Summary of Consular business, Records of official fees Miscelleneous expenses with vouchers General, Account current

I beg again to state that I have out no rent in my account, as that matter has not had any attention of mine, as I have had no advice from you: but Mr Jesse Sharp has rendered his lid to dat, which I enclose enclose
I trust these Returns will be found correct, and your satisfaction.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant,
Hon. George L. Rives Ass't Sec'y State.
1 Digest of Invoice Book 2 Arrival and departure of vessels 3 Summary of Consular business 4 Record of official fees 5 General Account Current 7 Mr Sharp's bill
